text: Let me go and run my code, will post my results back here

Ok so here is what I am doing,

form-integrations/v1/submissions/forms/{form.FormId}

Using Method.GET

"This OAuth token {token} has not authorized the required scopes to complete this action, requires all of the following: [forms]. Visit <https://developers.HubSpot.com/scopes> for more information."
if there is an error in the request, I would expect a 400 error from the API. Is 524 the response code they’re sending? The error message says a timeout occurred.

:wave: Hello, <@U02GDKRHGF2>
I am facing one issue in HubSpot and i'm very new person in HubSpot, i created one custom object which is called chapters and it is associated with contact while fetching chapter by ID with association i'm not getting contact-details. here i'm getting association id and type of association only.

can you guys please help me for this.

that’s what that endpoint returns. You could also use the Associations API, but that would give you roughly the same information. You then need to take those contact IDs in the results array and request details on them individually or use the bulk request endpoint <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/contacts|found here>.
Hi Team, I'm facing a issue in HubSpot with send mail api calling. can you guys please help me for this.
You haven’t been granted all required scopes to make that call
I'm passing all the required scopes but getting same error
I wonder if your API key has all the required permissions

Hi, quick question,
I built an APi, connected it to HubSpot, and right now when i try to add settings to the app (HubSpot side) The changes won't save and the deploy button isn't working.
I can click on both, but when exiting, it warns me about leaving with unsaved changes, and if I insist on leaving, none of the changes (or even the default placeholder) are saved. Am I forgetting an essential part? Thanks for your help everyone!
<@U02CUFSCXHQ> thank you so much sir for guiding me.:+1:
